page.title: 09Billericay Police Station
page.content: The{cells}are on the ground floor of the Police Station. There are about 3m by 4m. They each have a concrete bench and toilet. The windows in the cells are high, small and have iron bars across panes of reinforced glass. They are used for prisoners waiting to be tried for a crime in court, or for overnight prisoners. Also on the ground floor of the police station there is a{parade room, {operations room, Chief Inspector's {Office, Sergeant's Office.}First floor ,{C.I.D room, recreation room and an {interview room}where prisoners are questioned before being charged. There are 28 policemen and women, 2 C.I.D detectives, the Chief Inspector and a police Sergeant. There are 2{Panda Cars}and 1 area car which is used only in emergencies.
